title: Foundation: Learn Sewing and Pattern Making
description: Start with the fundamental craft. Learn to sew, both by hand and with a machine. Understand how to take measurements, draft basic patterns, and construct simple garments. This can be self-taught or through a local sewing class.
qualifications: Proficiency in sewing and pattern making

title: Formal Education in Fashion Design
description: To move from a tailor to a designer, formal education is crucial. Enroll in a diploma or degree program in fashion design. This will teach you about design principles, fashion history, illustration, and brand building.
institutes: University of Moratuwa (Fashion Design & Product Development)

title: Assistant Designer / Merchandiser in Apparel Industry
description: Gain industry experience by working for a large apparel manufacturer or a fashion brand in Sri Lanka. As an assistant designer, you'll support the design team. As a merchandiser, you'll learn about the commercial side of the business, from sourcing to production.

title: Fashion Designer
description: Work as a full-fledged fashion designer for a retail brand, or start creating small collections under your own name. You will be responsible for the entire design process, from conceptualization and sketching to sample development and final production.
qualifications: A strong portfolio of designed and created garments
salaryRangeLKR: LKR 100,000 - 200,000+ (for a brand) or Variable (own label)

title: Launch and Grow Your Own Fashion Brand
description: Establish your own fashion label as a registered business. This involves creating a distinct brand identity, managing production, marketing your collections, and building a customer base. The goal is to become a recognized name in the Sri Lankan fashion industry.
qualifications: Participation in Colombo Fashion Week (a major milestone)
